ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I can read Maya Hieroglyphic writing, just like the course title suggests. You also learn about Mayan culture and archeology, which is a nice plus.
I learned general things about different forms of writing, the ancient Maya lifestyle, the topics of Maya writing and art, how to read some hieroglyphs, amongst other things.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Lecture was a bit dull at times, but the sections where you learn to read the Maya glyphs were really cool!
I can't really think of weaknesses. You leave able to read Mayan glyphs. You'll be no expert, but you'll know all the grammar and tools needed to understand and signs and improve your comprehension.
Strengths: Really engaging information and very interactive learning Improvements: More time to study for the quizzes

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This course is only taught once every 3 or 4 years. A course of this type is only offered at a handful of institutions around the world. The Mayans are beautiful people. So, basically, take this course. Just do it. Don't let your dreams be dreams.

I would recommend this course. For me personally it was so important to learn a least a small piece of an indigenous culture. It is a lot of work at times, but later being able to read the hieroglyphs on artifacts feels so rewarding.
